title: Sound Design and Music Production Education Using Digital Audio Workstations

context.prior_knowledge: Basic music theory and understanding of DAW (Digital Audio Workstation) interfaces
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented course using VR simulations for DAW-based creative activities in smartphone-centered limited-technology environments, designed for workplace applicability

learning_goals: Learners can produce experimental 3-minute music compositions through sound design using basic tools of a Digital Audio Workstation (DAW)
Learners can implement spatial audio compositions by applying principles of spatial sound design in VR simulation environments
Learners can analyze acoustic characteristics by adjusting digital signal processing parameters and convert them into creative solutions

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
